title: 115_hr4427
content: The Act is titled the "Protecting America and American Workers Act" and includes provisions to reduce diversity visas and reallocate visas to benefit certain employment-based immigrants. The "Protecting America and American Workers Act" reduces diversity visas from 55,000 to 5,000 and reallocates visas to benefit certain employment-based immigrants starting in fiscal year 2019. In each fiscal year, 24,000 visas are available for qualified immigrants under different categories. The allocation of immigrant visas is amended under the "Protecting America and American Workers Act". The "Protecting America and American Workers Act" amends the allocation of immigrant visas by increasing the number of visas available in different categories. The amendments will take effect on October 1, 2018. The "Protecting America and American Workers Act" eliminates the Diversity Immigrant Program. The "Protecting America and American Workers Act" eliminates the Diversity Immigrant Program and makes amendments to the Immigration and Nationality Act regarding worldwide level of immigration and allocation of immigrant visas. The "Protecting America and American Workers Act" amends the Immigration and Nationality Act by changing procedures for granting immigrant status and determining the effective date for visa numbers. The "Protecting America and American Workers Act" amends the Immigration and Nationality Act by changing procedures for granting immigrant status and determining the effective date for visa numbers. The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the first day of the first fiscal year that begins after the date on which the determination is published in the Federal Register.
